thread.title: Sunderland defender Papy Djilobodji charged by FA following altercation with Darren Fletcher
thread.title_full: Sunderland defender Papy Djilobodji charged by FA following altercation with Darren Fletcher

author: Liam Corless
title: Sunderland defender Papy Djilobodji charged by FA following altercation with Darren Fletcher
text:
Sport Sunderland defender Papy Djilobodji charged by FA following altercation with Darren Fletcher The Sunderland defender appeared to strike West Brom's Darren Fletcher in the face with his arm on Saturday Share Papy Djilobodji is facing a potential four-game ban (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Papy Djilobodji could be sidelined until March after he was hit with an FA violent conduct charge. 
The Sunderland defender appeared to strike West Brom's Darren Fletcher in the face with his arm during the Black Cats' 2-0 defeat at the Hawthorns on Saturday. 
The incident went unseen by match officials but was caught by the TV cameras. 
Djilobodji has until 6pm on Tuesday 24 January to reply to the charge. Djilobodji appeared to punch Fletcher during Sunderland's loss to West Brom (Photo: BBC) The incident went unseen by officials but not by the TV cameras (Photo: BBC) 
If he accepts the charge he will be handed a four-match ban after he was sent off against Hull in November. 
Sunderland only have four games between now and the end of February, meaning Djilobodji might not play again until March 4 when Manchester City visit the Stadium of Light. Read More
